decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed extensions by reason of their combined excessive footprint and their encroachment on a private rear garden area, would represent overdevelopment of the site, and would result in an over-intensive and an inappropriate form of development contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policy D3.D(1) and D(11) of the London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1 (B) of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), policy DM 1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).

Reason : 2 - The proposal, by reason of its prominent siting, excessive width, and bulk, inappropriate proximity to site boundaries and lack of adequate setting space would result in a cramped, dominant form of development which would fail to respect the character and appearance of the site, the nearby buildings and the prevailing pattern of development in the area, to the detriment of the character and appearance of the streetscene and the local area, contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policies D3.D (1)  and D3.D (11) of the London Plan (2021); Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).
description: Single storey front extension incorporating porch, single storey side and rear extensions; re-location of main entrance; side to rear extension to create first floor level; alterations to roof; rooflights in front roofslope; external alterations (demolition of front porch and side canopy)
